content:
Please help me create a comprehensive security audit ticket based on the data already stored in the **IT Trouble Shooting Hub** page.

Your automation should:

1. In the **IT Inventory** database, find every item whose **Expiration date** is **before 2023-07-15**.
2. In the **IT FAQs** database, look up any FAQ entries that have the **"Security"** tag.
3. **Create a new page** inside the **IT Requests** database with **exact title**:
   
   `Quarterly Security Audit - Expired Assets Review`
4. Set its **Priority** property to **High**.
5. Set its **Due** property to **2023-06-22**.
6. In the page body, add a bullet-list block that enumerates **each expired inventory item**. **Each bullet item must follow this exact text format (including the dashes):**

   `<Serial> - <Tag> - <Recommendation>`

   • `<Serial>` is the item’s Serial value.
   • `<Tag>` is the first tag assigned to the inventory item (e.g., "Laptop").
   • `<Recommendation>` is a brief action you suggest based on the security FAQ entry (any text is acceptable).

   Example (do **not** copy):
   `ABC123 - Laptop - Renew warranty and enable disk encryption`

Note: Based on your understanding, solve the task all at once by yourself, don't ask for my opinions on anything.

content.text: I'll help you create a comprehensive security audit ticket. Let me start by discovering what actions are available in Notion to accomplish this task.

arguments: {"user_query": "create pages, query databases, search inventory, manage properties", "server_names": ["Notion"]}
name: discover_server_categories_or_actions

output: {"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"servers\\\":{\\\"Notion\\\":{\\\"detail_level\\\":\\\"categories_only\\\",\\\"details\\\":[\\\"NOTION_USERS\\\",\\\"NOTION_DATABASES\\\",\\\"NOTION_SEARCH\\\",\\\"NOTION_BLOCKS\\\",\\\"NOTION_PAGES\\\",\\\"NOTION_COMMENTS\\\"]}}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

content.text: Now let me get the details for the relevant categories to understand what actions I can perform:

output: {"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"category_actions\\\":{\\\"NOTION_DATABASES\\\":[\\\"post_database_query\\\",\\\"create_a_database\\\",\\\"update_a_database\\\",\\\"retrieve_a_database\\\"],\\\"NOTION_PAGES\\\":[\\\"retrieve_a_page\\\",\\\"patch_page\\\",\\\"post_page\\\",\\\"retrieve_a_page_property\\\"],\\\"NOTION_BLOCKS\\\":[\\\"get_block_children\\\",\\\"patch_block_children\\\",\\\"retrieve_a_block\\\",\\\"update_a_block\\\",\\\"delete_a_block\\\"]}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

content.text:
Perfect! Now I need to:
1. Query the IT Inventory database for expired items
2. Query the IT FAQs database for security-tagged entries
3. Create a new page in IT Requests database
4. Add content to that page

Let me start by getting the action details for querying databases:

output: {"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"name\\\":\\\"post_database_query\\\",\\\"method\\\":\\\"POST\\\",\\\"path\\\":\\\"/v1/databases/{database_id}/query\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Query a database\\\",\\\"tags\\\":[],\\\"path_params\\\":{\\\"database_id\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"format\\\":null,\\\"required\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"Identifier for a Notion database.\\\"}},\\\"query_params\\\":{\\\"filter_properties\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"array\\\",\\\"format\\\":null,\\\"required\\\":false,\\\"description\\\":\\\"A list of page property value IDs associated with the database. Use this param to limit the response to a specific page property value or values for pages that meet the `filter` criteria.\\\"}},\\\"body_schema\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"filter\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"When supplied, limits which pages are returned based on the [filter conditions](ref:post-database-query-filter).\\\"},\\\"sorts\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"array\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"When supplied, orders the results based on the provided [sort criteria](ref:post-database-query-sort).\\\",\\\"items\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"property\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"direction\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true}},\\\"required\\\":[\\\"property\\\",\\\"direction\\\"]}},\\\"start_cursor\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"When supplied, returns a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.\\\"},\\\"page_size\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"integer\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100\\\"},\\\"archived\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"boolean\\\"},\\\"in_trash\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"boolean\\\"}}},\\\"response_schema\\\":{}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

content.text: Now let me get details for creating a page:

output: {"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"name\\\":\\\"post_page\\\",\\\"method\\\":\\\"POST\\\",\\\"path\\\":\\\"/v1/pages\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Create a page\\\",\\\"tags\\\":[],\\\"path_params\\\":{},\\\"query_params\\\":{},\\\"body_schema\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"parent\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"page_id\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true}},\\\"required\\\":[\\\"page_id\\\"]},\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"title\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"array\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"type\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true}},\\\"required\\\":[\\\"title\\\"]},\\\"children\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"array\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"The content to be rendered on the new page, represented as an array of [block objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/block).\\\",\\\"items\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\"}},\\\"icon\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"The icon of the new page. Either an [emoji object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/emoji-object) or an [external file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object)..\\\",\\\"format\\\":\\\"json\\\"},\\\"cover\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"The cover image of the new page, represented as a [file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object).\\\",\\\"format\\\":\\\"json\\\"}},\\\"required\\\":[\\\"parent\\\",\\\"properties\\\"]},\\\"response_schema\\\":{}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

output: {"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"name\\\":\\\"patch_block_children\\\",\\\"method\\\":\\\"PATCH\\\",\\\"path\\\":\\\"/v1/blocks/{block_id}/children\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Append block children\\\",\\\"tags\\\":[],\\\"path_params\\\":{\\\"block_id\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"format\\\":null,\\\"required\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"Identifier for a [block](ref:block). Also accepts a [page](ref:page) ID.\\\"}},\\\"query_params\\\":{},\\\"body_schema\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"children\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"array\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Child content to append to a container block as an array of [block objects](ref:block)\\\",\\\"items\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"paragraph\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"bulleted_list_item\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"type\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true}}}},\\\"after\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"The ID of the existing block that the new block should be appended after.\\\"}},\\\"required\\\":[\\\"children\\\"]},\\\"response_schema\\\":{}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

content.text: Now I need to search for the database IDs. Let me search for IT-related databases:

arguments: {"server_name": "Notion", "query": "IT Inventory IT FAQs IT Requests database"}
name: search_documentation

output: {"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"query\\\":\\\"IT Inventory IT FAQs IT Requests database\\\",\\\"server_name\\\":\\\"Notion\\\",\\\"results\\\":[{\\\"name\\\":\\\"post_database_query\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Query a database\\\",\\\"category_name\\\":\\\"NOTION_DATABASES\\\"},{\\\"name\\\":\\\"patch_page\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Update page properties\\\",\\\"category_name\\\":\\\"NOTION_PAGES\\\"},{\\\"name\\\":\\\"update_a_database\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Update a database\\\",\\\"category_name\\\":\\\"NOTION_DATABASES\\\"},{\\\"name\\\":\\\"post_search\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Search by title\\\",\\\"category_name\\\":\\\"NOTION_SEARCH\\\"},{\\\"name\\\":\\\"retrieve_a_page_property\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Retrieve a page property item\\\",\\\"category_name\\\":\\\"NOTION_PAGES\\\"},{\\\"name\\\":\\\"post_page\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Create a page\\\",\\\"category_name\\\":\\\"NOTION_PAGES\\\"},{\\\"name\\\":\\\"retrieve_a_comment\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Retrieves a list of un-resolved [Comment objects](ref:comment-object) from a page or block.\\\",\\\"category_name\\\":\\\"NOTION_COMMENTS\\\"},{\\\"name\\\":\\\"update_a_block\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Update a block\\\",\\\"category_name\\\":\\\"NOTION_BLOCKS\\\"},{\\\"name\\\":\\\"get_block_children\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Retrieve block children\\\",\\\"category_name\\\":\\\"NOTION_BLOCKS\\\"},{\\\"name\\\":\\\"patch_block_children\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Append block children\\\",\\\"category_name\\\":\\\"NOTION_BLOCKS\\\"}],\\\"total_results\\\":10}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

{"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"name\\\":\\\"post_search\\\",\\\"method\\\":\\\"POST\\\",\\\"path\\\":\\\"/v1/search\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Search by title\\\",\\\"tags\\\":[],\\\"path_params\\\":{},\\\"query_params\\\":{},\\\"body_schema\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"query\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"The text that the API compares page and database titles against.\\\"},\\\"sort\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"A set of criteria, `direction` and `timestamp` keys, that orders the results. The **only** supported timestamp value is `\\\\\\\"last_edited_time\\\\\\\"`. Supported `direction` values are `\\\\\\\"ascending\\\\\\\"` and `\\\\\\\"descending\\\\\\\"`. If `sort` is not provided, then the most recently edited results are returned first.\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"direction\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The direction to sort. Possible values include `ascending` and `descending`.\\\"},\\\"timestamp\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The name of the timestamp to sort against. Possible values include `last_edited_time`.\\\"}}},\\\"filter\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"A set of criteria, `value` and `property` keys, that limits the results to either only pages or only databases. Possible `value` values are `\\\\\\\"page\\\\\\\"` or `\\\\\\\"database\\\\\\\"`. The only supported `property` value is `\\\\\\\"object\\\\\\\"`.\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"value\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The value of the property to filter the results by.  Possible values for object type include `page` or `database`.  **Limitation**: Currently the only filter allowed is `object` which will filter by type of object (either `page` or `database`)\\\"},\\\"property\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The name of the property to filter by. Currently the only property you can filter by is the object type.  Possible values include `object`.   Limitation: Currently the only filter allowed is `object` which will filter by type of object (either `page` or `database`)\\\"}}},\\\"start_cursor\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"A `cursor` value returned in a previous response that If supplied, limits the response to results starting after the `cursor`. Refer to [pagination](https://developers.notion.com/reference/intro#pagination) for more details.\\\"},\\\"page_size\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"integer\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"The number of items from the full list to include in the response. Maximum: `100`.\\\",\\\"format\\\":\\\"int32\\\"}}},\\\"response_schema\\\":{}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

content.text:
Great! I found all the databases I need:
- IT Inventory: 27460215-0acf-817d-b8bf-d2398de06afb
- IT FAQs: 27460215-0acf-819d-801e-d7b9d4ae6c22
- IT Requests: 27460215-0acf-817b-875b-c37079c0b05f

Now let me query the IT Inventory database for items with expiration dates before 2023-07-15:
Great! I found 5 expired inventory items. Now let me query the IT FAQs database for entries with the "Security" tag:

output: {"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"server_name\\\":\\\"Notion\\\",\\\"action_name\\\":\\\"post_database_query\\\",\\\"execution_result\\\":{\\\"error\\\":\\\"API error (HTTP 400)\\\",\\\"details\\\":{\\\"object\\\":\\\"error\\\",\\\"status\\\":400,\\\"code\\\":\\\"validation_error\\\",\\\"message\\\":\\\"Could not find property with name or id: Tags\\\",\\\"request_id\\\":\\\"30417cb7-528d-4b0c-b2b0-3f8656bc8587\\\"},\\\"status_code\\\":400}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

- Task name (title)
- Priority

content.text:
Perfect! I have successfully created the comprehensive security audit ticket. Let me summarize what was accomplished:

## Task Completed Successfully

I have created a comprehensive security audit ticket in the **IT Requests** database with the following details:

### **Created Page:**
- **Title:** `Quarterly Security Audit - Expired Assets Review` (exact as requested)
- **Priority:** High 
- **Due Date:** 2023-06-22
- **Page ID:** 27460215-0acf-81c9-a532-ea48e072cc4c

### **Expired Inventory Items Found (before 2023-07-15):**
I identified 5 expired items from the IT Inventory database and created bullet points following the exact format `<Serial> - <Tag> - <Recommendation>`:

1. **32x11PIP - Computer Accessory** - Report security incident and disconnect device immediately
2. **36x10PIQ - Computer Accessory** - Contact IT support immediately for security assessment  
3. **76x87PCY - Laptop** - Disconnect from network and contact IT support for malware scan
4. **192371-8910/54 - Computer Accessory** - Mark as spam and add to block list, contact IT support
5. **65XYQ/GB - License** - Report security incident and review access permissions

### **Security FAQ Integration:**
I found 3 relevant security FAQ entries from the IT FAQs database with "Security & Malware" category and incorporated their recommendations into the audit recommendations:
- How to report security incidents
- Managing spam emails  
- Handling suspected malware/viruses

The security audit ticket is now live in the IT Requests database and ready for the IT team to review and take action on the expired assets.
